    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws BagTransferException
        Description copied from interface: FileFetcher
        Permits the FileFetcher to initialize. Guaranteed to be called prior to any calls to fetchFile().
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface FileFetcher
        Throws:
        BagTransferException - Thrown if an error occurs during initialization.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: FileFetcher
        Permits the FileFetcher to clean up. Guaranteed to not be called until all calls to fetchFile() are completed, and no more class to fetchFile() will occur after the call to FileFetcher.close().
        Specified by:
        close in interface FileFetcher

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Description copied from interface: Cancellable

        Cancels a long-running operation. The operation may not be terminated immediately, but may end at the earliest possible convenience of the implementor.

        Consecutive calls to this method must not have any additional effect.

        The Cancellable.isCancelled() property must be set to return true by the end of the cancel method.

        The state of the operation after a cancel is undefined by this method, but gurantees may be made by particular implementors.

        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Cancellable
        Overrides:
        cancel in class LongRunningOperationBase

      • fetchFile

        public void fetchFile(java.net.URI uri,
             java.lang.Long size,
             FetchedFileDestination destination,
             FetchContext context)
               throws BagTransferException
        Description copied from interface: FileFetcher
        Fetches a single file. Each call to this method corresponds to the desire to fetch a single line from a fetch.txt.
        Specified by:
        fetchFile in interface FileFetcher
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to be fetched. If the URI scheme cannotbe handled by this fetcher, then a BagTransferException should be thrown.
        size - The size of the file. If no size was specified, this will be null.
        destination - The destination for the fetched file.
        context - The context for this fetch.
        Throws:
        BagTransferException - Thrown if the file could not be fetched for any reason.
